subject: Translate Udev Event path to a generic path
commitMessage:
Translate Udev Event path to a generic path

Given Udev event generated path is translated into sys bus path - as the json will
have the sys/bus path.

Test:
-> Translation successful for all frus including frus behind muxes.
-> If the system vpd is triggered by udev event, then the execution stops as
the system vpd will already be parsed via system-vpd.service.

Few Reasons why we translate the path to a generic path:
	-> Each i2c bus is memory mapped to a certain address in ASPEED.
	   In future if there are any architectural changes in the kernel, we need to
	   make changes to the JSON accordingly.
	-> Also in future if the system runs on a different ASPEED, we need to
	   update the JSON accordingly.
	-> This generic /sys/bus path represents the system wiring and doesnot rely on
	   how the busses are memory mapped.
	-> Also for call out based events, generic path is expected than the udev event path.

Sample Udev Event i2c path : "/sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e78a480.i2c-bus/i2c-8/8-0050/8-00500/nvmem"
Which gets translated to /sys/bus/ path as : "/sys/bus/i2c/drivers/at24/8-0050/eeprom"

Sample Udev Event spi path : "/sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/1e79b000.fsi/fsi-master/fsi0/slave@00:00/00:00:00:0a/fsi-master/fsi1/slave@03:00/01:03:00:04/spi_master/spi6/spi6.0/spi6.00/nvmem"
Which gets translated to /sys/bus/ path as : "/sys/bus/spi/drivers/at25/spi6.0/eeprom"

Sample Udev Event i2c path for frus behind mux : "/sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e78a300.i2c-bus/i2c-5/i2c-24/24-0051/24-00510/nvmem"
Which gets translated to generic path as /sys/bus/i2c/drivers/at24/24-0051/eeprom

Tested on simics:

<the inventory json should have generic eeprom paths for all frus>

root@rainier:/tmp# ./ibm-read-vpd-UG -f /sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/1e79b000.fsi/fsi-master/fsi0/slave@00:00/00:00:00:04/spi_master/spi12/spi12.0/spi12.00/nvmem
the path after translation : /sys/bus/spi/drivers/at25/spi12.0/eeprom

root@rainier:/tmp# ./ibm-read-vpd-UG -f /sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e78a480.i2c-bus/i2c-8/8-0051/8-00510/nvmem
the path after translation : /sys/bus/i2c/drivers/at24/8-0051/eeprom

root@rainier:/tmp# ./ibm-read-vpd-UG -f /sys/bus/i2c/drivers/at24/8-0051/8-00510/nvmem
the path after translation : /sys/bus/i2c/drivers/at24/8-0051/eeprom

Signed-off-by: PriyangaRamasamy <priyanga24@in.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I6d5995a85ef15e63d2d0b6f054fb0bf14a2b756c

Change has been successfully merged by Santosh Puranik
No SMS lingo :) Also the comment does not match the actual check being performed.
Please add a trace here that says we translated path to "file"
If these two paths are not just specific to this method then can we have it in const.hpp?
I doubt if we have a use for these outside of these methods. Still, no harm in moving them.
Please initialise with a default value.
Please remove this. We are not going to host the JSON in meta-ibm anymore. Instead you might want to just give an example translation/test results here.
In the interest of readability, please provide an example udev event path for both SPI and I2C and describe how the corresponding regex will match and translate them to the output path.
I think we should remove this, just return an empty string, trace out the incoming path and let us just ignore the udev event.
Avoid additional variable udevPath. pass file as reference to the udevToGenericPath() api. and revert the change at line 936 to have a single variable string file{} only;

In case a file is empty and we are not going to collect VPD for that stating that the udevPath is not valid. 
Shouldn't we log PEL in this case as VPD for this EEPROM will never be collected till the path from Udev is corrected?
yes we can log in EepromException - which is not merged- defined here (yet https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/openpower-vpd-parser/+/41464/2/vpd_exceptions.hpp )
I don't think we should - This is most certainly not an EEPROM exception. I would be OK to just do a normal log<> and return 0.
In case we are not logging PELs for exceptions beyond EEPROM data handling then I am ok with this.
I am a little concerned that we'll start seeing service failures for spurious UDEV events. Hence I recommended we just return 0
Please remove this, I have seen instances where we get udev events to non-existing files and I would just like this to fail at line 1003

the variable "file" is modified and returned.
so may be I'll not return file from this api as its passed by reference.
Break after the first match? Also how do we handle the case where we did not find the said pattern?
In fact to handle muxed buses, you will have to match the last i2c-*, so we definitely should not break on the first match, so this is OK, please ignore my comment about breaking on teh first match.

I just discovered that with kernel 5.10, this value is no longer guaranteed to be 0, therefore, we cannot include this in our VPD JSON.

How about we modify this a little to get the <bus>-<00addr> and append an /eeprom to it?

modify what?
how does the udev path look in kernel 5.10 ?

Here's how it looks on 5.10 (I have a simulation session running with that in case you want to look). For ex:

/sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb\:apb/ahb\:apb\:bus\@1e78a000/1e78a480.i2c-bus/i2c-8/8-0051/8-005112/nvmem ==> Notice the 0051(12), this used to be 0051(0)

I guess what I am saying is we simply extract the I2C bus number and address from the udev string and create this out of it:
/sys/bus/i2c/drivers/at24/<bus>-00<addr>/eeprom

ok. the existing json was having all generic nvmem paths <https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/meta-ibm/+/36296/2/meta-witherspoon/recipes-phosphor/vpd/ibm-vpd-parser/50001001.json> 
now to get rid of the nvmem dependency, will make the json to have generic eeprom paths only and will modify this code accrodingly.
I guess the same thing could happen here too, although the path here still matches what is in kernel 5.10, I think we should look for (spi)[0-9].0 and append /eeprom to it

ok.. so you say we won't have "<seg>/nvmem" in udev path in kernel 5.10..

the path's end segment looks like 

/sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/1e79b000.fsi/fsi-master/fsi0/slave@00:00/00:00:00:04/spi_master/spi(digit)/spi(digit).0/eeprom 
&&
/sys/devices/platform/ahb/ahb:apb/ahb:apb:bus@1e78a000/1e78a480.i2c-bus/
i2c-(digit)/i2c-(digit-addr)/eeprom  ?

We may or may not have nvmem. I think all we really need is the spi bus number to create:
/sys/bus/spi/drivers/at25/spi<busnum>.0/eeprom
Break after first match? What if nothing matches?

should I really need a break here for spi paths?

What if nothing matches?
I can have a match.size() check and throw error if there is no match.
caught the case where there is no pattern match in ps:10
I'd remove this and keep the one at line 907

dump bad vpd api will be in all catch blocks and requires the file as input.
So having "file" in line 890 will have use case.
Please do so as a part of that commit, then
We already have this check at line 989. Do we need at both the places or one can be removed?
I think we can remove the one at line 989
When the vpd file is empty, we don't want to throw an exception right. we just ignore the file and proceed with execution success status. So we can remove the one at line 989.
Ok, but still we need to remove one?
